segments.text: The boy on the stool is reaching for cookies like his life depends on it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I’m amazed he hasn’t fallen yet with how wobbly that stool looks.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for him to hand her one like it’s the most normal thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but laugh at how sneaky they’re being.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is right there, and she has no idea what’s happening behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring out of the sink, and none of them seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if they’ve done this before and gotten away with it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is about to tip, and I’m holding my breath waiting for it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl looks so innocent, but she’s just as guilty as the boy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope they get away with it, but I know they’re going to get caught.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is just a mess waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR
